member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace supports Piccolo activities. Activities are used to control some time dependent aspect of Piccolo such as animation

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.TerminationBehavior
member.summary: This enumeration is used by the PActivity class. It defines the behavior an activity has when its Terminate method is called.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.TerminationBehavior.TerminateWithoutFinishing
member.summary: The method OnActivityFinished will never get called and so the activity will be terminated midway.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.TerminationBehavior.TerminateAndFinish
member.summary: The method OnActivityFinished will always get called. And so the activity will always end in it's completed state. If the activity has not yet started the method OnActivityStarted will also be called.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.TerminationBehavior.TerminateAndFinishIfStepping
member.summary: The method OnActivityFinished will only be called if the activity has previously started.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.ActivityStartedDelegate
member.summary: Used to notify classes when the activity has started.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.ActivitySteppedDelegate
member.summary: Used to notify classes when the activity is running.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.ActivityFinishedDelegate
member.summary: Used to notify classes when the activity has finished.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity
member.summary: PActivity controls some time dependent aspect of Piccolo, such as animation.
member.remarks: Once created activities must be scheduled with the PActivityScheduler managed by the PRoot to run. They are automatically removed from the scheduler when the animation has finished.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.ActivityStarted
member.summary: Used to notify classes when the activity has started.
member.remarks: When the PActivityDelegate is set, the ActivityStarted() method is connected to the this delegate.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.ActivityStepped
member.summary: Used to notify classes when the activity is running.
member.remarks: When the PActivityDelegate is set, the ActivityStepped() method is connected to the this delegate.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.ActivityFinished
member.summary: Used to notify classes when the activity has finished.
member.remarks: When the PActivityDelegate is set, the ActivityFinished() method is connected to this delegate.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a new PActivity.
member.param: The amount of time this activity should take to complete, -1 for infinite.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a new PActivity.
member.param: The amount of time this activity should take to complete, -1 for infinite.
The minimum number of milliseconds that this activity should delay between steps.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a new PActivity.
member.param: The amount of time this activity should take to complete, -1 for infinite.
The minimum number of milliseconds that this activity should delay between steps.
The time (relative to PUtil.CurrentTimeMillis) that this activity should start.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.OnActivityStarted
member.summary: This method is called right before an activity is scheduled to start running.
member.remarks: After this method is called OnActivityStep() will be called until the activity finishes.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.OnActivityStep(System.Int64)
member.summary: This method is called repeatedly when the activity is running.
member.param: The amount of time that has passed relative to the activities startTime.
member.remarks: This is the method that most activities override to perform their behavior.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.OnActivityFinished
member.summary: This method is called after an activity has finished running and the activity has been removed from the PActivityScheduler queue.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.StartAfter(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: Schedules this activity to start after the first activity has finished.
member.param: The activity to start after.
member.remarks: Note that no link is created between these activities, if the startTime or duration of the first activity is later changed this activities start time will not be updated to reflect that change.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.Terminate
member.summary: Stop this activity immediately, and remove it from the activity scheduler.
member.remarks: The default termination behavior is to call OnActivityFinished() if the activity is currently stepping. Use Terminate(TerminationBehavior) for a different termination behavior.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.Terminate(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.TerminationBehavior)
member.summary: Stop this activity immediately, and remove it from the activity scheduler.
member.remarks: The TerminationBehavior determines when and if OnActivityStarted and OnActivityFinished get called.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.ProcessStep(System.Int64)
member.summary: The activity scheduler calls this method and it is here that the activity decides if it should do a step or not for the given time.
member.param: The time for which this activity must decide whether or not to step.
member.returns: The step rate of this activity, -1 if past the stopTime.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this object for debugging purposes.
member.returns: A string representation of this node's state.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that this activity should start running in PRoot global time.
member.value: The time that this activity should start.
member.remarks: When this time is reached (or soon after) this activity will have its OnActivityStarted() method called.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.StepInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of milliseconds that this activity should delay between steps.
member.value: The minimum number of milliseconds that this activity should delay between steps.

member.summary: Gets the next time this activity should step, in PRoot global time.
member.value: The next step time for this activity.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that this activity should take to complete, after the OnActivityStarted method is called.
member.value: The amount of time this activity should take to complete.

member.summary: Gets or sets the activity scheduler associated with this activity.
member.value: The activity scheduler associated with this activity.
member.remarks: An activity scheduler manages a list of activities to be run. Typically, activities are scheduled with the activity scheduler stored in the root node of the scene graph tree.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.IsStepping
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this activity is stepping.
member.value: True if this activity is stepping; else false.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.IsAnimation

member.value: True if this activity is performing an animation; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets the PActivityDelegate for this activity.
member.value: The PActivityDelegate associated with this activity.
member.remarks: The delegate is notified when the activity starts and stops stepping.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.StopTime
member.summary: Gets the time when this activity should finish running.
member.value: The time when this activity should finish running.
member.remarks: At this time (or soon after) the OnActivityFinished() method will be called

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.ParamString
member.summary: Gets a string representing the state of this object.
member.value: A string representation of this object's state.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.PActivityDelegate
member.summary: PActivityDelegate is used by classes to learn about and act on the different states that a PActivity goes through, such as when the activity starts and stops stepping.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.PActivityDelegate.ActivityStarted(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: This method is used to notify a user right before an activity is scheduled to start running.
member.remarks: This method will be connected to the ActivityStarted delegate, which is called from the OnActivityStarted() method.
member.param: The activity that is about to start.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.PActivityDelegate.ActivityStepped(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: This method is used to notify a user when the activity is running.
member.remarks: This method will be connected to the ActivityStepped delegate, which is called from the OnActivityStep() method.
member.param: The activity that is running.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity.PActivityDelegate.ActivityFinished(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: This method is used to notify a user after an activity has finished running and the activity has been removed from the PActivityScheduler queue.
member.remarks: This method will be connected to the ActivityFinished delegate, which is called from the OnActivityStarted() method.
member.param: The activity that has just finished.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivityScheduler
member.summary: PActivityScheduler is responsible for managing a list of activities to be processed.
member.remarks:
PActivityScheduler is given a chance to process these activities from the PRoot's ProcessInputs() method. Most users will not need to use the PActivityScheduler directly, instead you should look at:
PNode.AddActivity - to schedule a new activity
PActivity.Terminate - to terminate a running activity
PRoot.ProcessInputs - already calls processActivities for you.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivityScheduler.#ctor(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PRoot)
member.summary: Constructs a new PActivityScheduler.
member.param: The root node to associate with this activity scheduler.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivityScheduler.AddActivity(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: Add this activity to the scheduler.
member.param: The activity to be added.
member.remarks: Adding an activity schedules that activity to run at some point in the future.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivityScheduler.AddActivity(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add this activity to the scheduler.
member.param: The activity to be added.
Specifies whether the activity should be run last.
member.remarks:
Adding an activity schedules that activity to run at some point in the future.
Sometimes it's useful to make sure that an activity is run after all other activities have been run. To do this set processLast to true when adding the activity.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivityScheduler.RemoveActivity(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: Remove this activity from the scheduler.
member.param: The activity to be removed.
member.remarks: Once an activity has been removed from the scheduler, it will no longer be run.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivityScheduler.RemoveAllActivities
member.summary: Removes all activities currently scheduled to run.
member.remarks: This method clears the scheduler.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PColorActivity
member.summary: PColorActivity interpolates between two colors for its target over the duration of the animation.
member.remarks: The source color is retrieved from the target just before the activity is scheduled to start.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PInterpolatingActivity
member.summary: PInterpolatingActivity interpolates between two states (source and destination) over the duration of the activity.
member.remarks:
The interpolation can be either linear or slow- in, slow-out.
The mode determines how the activity interpolates between the two states. The default mode interpolates from source to destination, but you can also go from destination to source, and from source to destination to source.
A loopCount of greater then one will make the activity reschedule itself when it has finished. This makes the activity loop between the two states.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PInterpolatingActivity.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a new PInterpolatingActivity that will interpolate from the source state to the destination state.
member.param: The length of one loop of the activity.
The minimum number of milliseconds that this activity should delay between steps.

member.summary: Constructs a new PInterpolatingActivity that will interpolate from the source state to the destination state, looping the given number of iterations.
member.param: The length of one loop of the activity.
The minimum number of milliseconds that this activity should delay between steps.
The number of times the activity should reschedule itself.
The mode defines how the activity interpolates between states.

member.summary: Constructs a new PInterpolatingActivity that will interpolate between two states in the order specified by the mode, starting at the given start time and looping the given number of iterations.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PBasicInputEventHandler
member.summary: PBasicInputEventHandler is the standard class in Piccolo that is used to register for mouse and keyboard events on a PNode.
member.remarks:
The events that you get depends on the node that you have registered with. For example you will only get mouse moved events when the mouse is over the node that you have registered with, not when the mouse is over some other node.
There are a couple of ways to use this event handler class. You can extend PBasicInputEventHandler and override the OnEvent methods or you can instantiate a PBasicInputEventHandler and attach a handler method to one of the event delegates.
Note: you can also attach an event handler method directly to an event on a node, but you will lose the ability to implement a filter or add other state to your event handler. See the events in PNode for more details.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PInputEventListener
member.summary: PInputEventListener defines an interface for objects that want to listen to PNodes for input events. If you are just using Piccolo's default input management system then you will most often use PBasicInputEventHandler to register with a node for input events.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PDragEventHandler
member.summary: PDragEventHandler is a simple event handler for dragging a node on the canvas.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PDragSequenceEventHandler
member.summary: PDragSequenceEventHandler is designed to support mouse pressed, dragged, and released interaction sequences. Support is also provided for running a continuous activity during the drag sequence.
member.remarks: PDragSequenceEventHandler should be subclassed by a concrete event handler that implements a particular interaction. See PPanEventHandler, PZoomEventHandler, and PDragEventHandler for examples

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PDragSequenceEventHandler.OnStartDrag(System.Object,UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PInputEventArgs)
member.summary: Subclasses should override this method to get notified of the start of a new drag sequence.
member.param: The source of the start drag event.
A PInputEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks:
This method is called at the beginning of a drag sequence.
Unlike the method, this method will not get called until after the has been reached.
Notes to Inheritors: Overriding methods must still call base.OnStartDrag() for correct behavior.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PDragSequenceEventHandler.OnDrag(System.Object,UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PInputEventArgs)
member.summary: Subclasses should override this method to get notified of the drag events in a drag sequence.
member.param: The source of the end drag event.
A PInputEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks:
This method is called in the middle of a drag sequence, between the and the methods.
Unlike the method, this method will not get called until after the has been reached.
Notes to Inheritors: Overriding methods must still call base.OnDrag() for correct behavior.

member.summary: Subclasses should override this method to get notified of the end event in a drag sequence.
member.param: The source of the end drag event.
A PInputEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks:
This method is called at the end of a drag sequence.
Unlike the method, this method will not get called until after the has been reached.
Notes to Inheritors: Overriding methods must still call base.OnEndDrag() for correct behavior.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PInputEventArgs
member.summary: PInputEventArgs is used to pass keyboard and mouse event data to PInputEventListeners.
member.remarks:
This class has methods for normal event properties such as event modifier keys and event canvas location.
In addition it has methods to get the mouse position and delta in a variety of coordinate systems.
Last of all, it provides access to the dispatch manager that can be queried to find the current mouse over, mouse focus, and keyboard focus.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PZoomEventHandler
member.summary: ZoomEventhandler provides event handlers for basic zooming of the canvas view with the right (third) button.
member.remarks: Tthe initial mouse press defines the zoom anchor point, and then moving the mouse to the right zooms with a speed proportional to the amount the mouse is moved to the right of the anchor point. Similarly, if the mouse is moved to the left, the the view is zoomed out.

member.value: The minimum view magnification factor.
member.remarks:
When this property is set the camera is left at its current scale evem if the value is larger than the current scale.
The value must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PZoomEventHandler.MaxScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum view magnification factor that this event handler is bound by.
member.value: The maximum view magnification factor.
member.remarks:
When this property is set the camera is left at its current scale even if the value is smaller than the current scale.
The value must be greater than 0.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Nodes.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains nodes that may be useful for Piccolo applications. These nodes are intended to be useful, but not definitive. Many applications will also end up defining their nodes which can be used along with these.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Nodes.PImage
member.summary: PImage is a wrapper around a System.Drawing.Image.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode
member.summary: PNode is the central abstraction in Piccolo. All objects that are visible on the screen are instances of the node class. All nodes may have other "child" nodes added to them.
member.remarks: See UMD.HCIL.PiccoloExample.NodeExample for demonstrations of how nodes can be used and how new types of nodes can be created.

member.summary: The bounds of this node, stored in local coordinates.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new PNode.
member.Remarks: By default a node's brush is null, and bounds are empty. These values must be set for the node to show up on the screen once it's added to a scene graph.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.AnimateToBounds(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int64)
member.summary: Animate this node's bounds from their current location when the activity starts to the specified bounds.
member.param: The x coordinate of the target bounds.
The y coordinate of the target bounds.
The width of the target bounds.
The height of the target bounds.
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity.
member.remarks: If this node descends from the root then the activity will be scheduled, else the returned activity should be scheduled manually. If two different transform activities are scheduled for the same node at the same time, they will both be applied to the node, but the last one scheduled will be applied last on each frame, so it will appear to have replaced the original. Generally you will not want to do that. Note this method animates the node's bounds, but does not change the node's matrix. Use AnimateMatrixToBounds to animate the node's matrix instead.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.AnimateMatrixToBounds(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int64)
member.summary: Animate this node from it's current matrix when the activity starts a new matrix that will fit the node into the given bounds.
member.param: The x coordinate of the target bounds.
The y coordinate of the target bounds.
The width of the target bounds.
The height of the target bounds.
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity.
member.remarks: If this node descends from the root then the activity will be scheduled, else the returned activity should be scheduled manually. If two different transform activities are scheduled for the same node at the same time, they will both be applied to the node, but the last one scheduled will be applied last on each frame, so it will appear to have replaced the original. Generally you will not want to do that. Note this method animates the node's matrix, but does not directly change the node's bounds rectangle. Use AnimateToBounds to animate the node's bounds rectangle instead.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.AnimateToPositionScaleRotation(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int64)
member.summary: Animate this node's matrix from its current location when the activity starts to the specified location, scale, and rotation.
member.param: The x coordinate of the target location.
The y coordinate of the target location
The scale of the target matrix
The rotation of the target matrix
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity.
member.remarks: If this node descends from the root then the activity will be scheduled, else the returned activity should be scheduled manually. If two different transform activities are scheduled for the same node at the same time, they will both be applied to the node, but the last one scheduled will be applied last on each frame, so it will appear to have replaced the original. Generally you will not want to do that.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.AnimateToMatrix(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix,System.Int64)
member.summary: Animate this node's matrix from its current values when the activity starts to the new values specified in the given matrix.
member.param: The final matrix value.
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity
member.remarks: If this node descends from the root then the activity will be scheduled, else the returned activity should be scheduled manually. If two different transform activities are scheduled for the same node at the same time, they will both be applied to the node, but the last one scheduled will be applied last on each frame, so it will appear to have replaced the original. Generally you will not want to do that.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.AnimateToColor(System.Drawing.Color,System.Int64)
member.summary: Animate this node's color from its current value to the new value specified.
member.param: The final color value.
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity.
member.remarks: This method assumes that this nodes Brush property is of type SolidBrush. If this node descends from the root then the activity will be scheduled, else the returned activity should be scheduled manually. If two different color activities are scheduled for the same node at the same time, they will both be applied to the node, but the last one scheduled will be applied last on each frame, so it will appear to have replaced the original. Generally you will not want to do that.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.AddActivity(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Activities.PActivity)
member.summary: Schedule the given activity with the root.
member.param: The new activity to schedule.
member.returns: True if the activity is successfully scheduled.
member.remarks: Note that only scheduled activities will be stepped. If the activity is successfully added true is returned, else false.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.Clone

member.returns: A new copy of this node or null if the node was not serializable
member.remarks: Note that copying is implemented in terms of c# serialization. See the serialization notes for more information.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.OnKeyDown(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Event.PInputEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the KeyDown event.
member.param: A PInputEventArgs that contains the event data
member.remarks:
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The OnKeyDown method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnKeyDown in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnKeyDown method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.Lerp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between a and b, based on t. Specifically, it computes Lerp(a, b, t) = a + t*(b - a). This produces a result that changes from a (when t = 0) to b (when t = 1).
member.param: The variable 'time' parameter.
The starting value.
The ending value.
member.returns: A value between a and b determined by t.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.Position(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Int32)
member.summary: Animate this node's matrix to one that will make this node appear at the specified position relative to the specified bounding box.
member.remarks:
The source point specifies a point in the unit square (0, 0) - (1, 1) that represents an anchor point on the corresponding node to this matrox. The destination point specifies an anchor point on the reference node. The position method then computes the matrix that results in transforming this node so that the source anchor point coincides with the reference anchor point. This can be useful for layout algorithms as it is straightforward to position one object relative to another.
For example, If you have two nodes, A and B, and you call
PointF srcPt = new PointF(1.0f, 0.0f); PointF destPt = new PointF(0.0f, 0.0f); A.Position(srcPt, destPt, B.GlobalBounds, 750);
The result is that A will move so that its upper-right corner is at the same place as the upper-left corner of B, and the transition will be smoothly animated over a period of 750 milliseconds.

member.summary: Swaps this node out of the scene graph tree, and replaces it with the specified replacement node.
member.param: The new node that replaces the current node in the scene graph tree.
member.remarks: This node is left dangling, and it is up to the caller to manage it. The replacement node will be added to this node's parent in the same position as this node was located. That is, if this was the 3rd child of its parent, then after calling ReplaceWith, the replacement node will also be the 3rd child of its parent. If this node has no parent when ReplaceWith is called, then nothing will be done at all.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset applied to this node by its matrix.

Unlike PNode.TranslateBy(), this is not affected by the scale value of the matrix.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PNode.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y offset applied to this node by its matrix.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Nodes.PPath
member.summary: PPath is a wrapper around a System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath.
member.remarks:
The SetBounds method works by scaling the path to fit into the specified bounds. This normally works well, but if the specified base bounds get too small then it is impossible to expand the path shape again since all its numbers have tended to zero, so application code may need to take this into consideration.
One option that applications have is to call StartResizeBounds before starting an interaction that may make the bounds very small, and calling EndResizeBounds when this interaction is finished. When this is done PPath will use a copy of the original path to do the resizing so the numbers in the path wont loose resolution.
This class also provides methods for constructing common shapes using a GraphicsPath.
Performance Note: Checking for intersections between some paths and rectangles can be very slow. This is due to the way .NET implements the IsVisible method. The problem generally occurs in extreme cases, when the path consists of numerous lines joined at very steep angles, which exhausts the intersection algorithm. One simple workaround is to break the figure up into several PPath nodes. Also, remember to set the Brush to null if you do not want to a fill a path. Otherwise, the path will be filled with a white brush, and picking will be more expensive.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Nodes.PPath.Intersects(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Returns true if this path intersects the given rectangle.
member.remarks:
This method first checks if the interior of the path intersects with the rectangle. If not, the method then checks if the path bounding the pen stroke intersects with the rectangle. If either of these cases are true, this method returns true.
Performance Note: For some paths, this method can be very slow. This is due to the implementation of IsVisible. The problem usually occurs when many lines are joined at very steep angles. See PPath Overview for workarounds.
member.param: The rectangle to check for intersection.
member.returns: True if this path intersects the given rectangle; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Nodes.PPath.PickAfterChildren(UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PPickPath)
member.summary: Overridden. Performs picking in canvas coordinates if PickMode is false.
member.remarks: Due to the implementation of the GraphicsPath object, picking in canvas coordinates is more accurate, but will introduce a significant performance hit.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Nodes.PPath.Intersects(System.Drawing.RectangleF,UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix)
member.summary: Returns true if this path intersects the given rectangle.
member.remarks:
This method first checks if the interior of the path intersects with the rectangle. If not, the method then checks if the path bounding the pen stroke intersects with the rectangle. If either of these cases are true, this method returns true.
Performance Note: For some paths, this method can be very slow. This is due to the implementation of IsVisible. The problem usually occurs when many lines are joined at very steep angles. See PPath Overview for workarounds.
member.param: The rectangle to check for intersection.
A matrix object that specifies a transform to apply to the path and bounds before checking for an intersection.
member.returns: True if this path intersects the given rectangle; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PDebug.DebugThreading
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that checks for whether the scene graph is modified outside the event thread. Piccolo is not thread safe, and so no part of the scene graph can be modified outside the event thread. It takes time to check, so only turn this flag on for debugging. If the scene graph is modified outside the event thread, a message will be printed out.
member.value: A flag that indicates whether the scene graph is checked to make sure it is modified only within the event thread.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix
member.summary: PMatrix is a wrapper around a System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix that includes several convenience methods.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new PMatrix initialized to the identity matrix.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix.#ctor(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: Constructs a new PMatrix initialized to the geometric transform defined by the specified rectangle and array of points.
member.param: A structure that represents the rectangle to be transformed.

An array of three structures that represents the points of a parallelogram to which the upper-left, upper-right, and lower-left corners of the rectangle is to be transformed. The lower-right corner of the parallelogram is implied by the first three corners.
member.remarks: This method initializes the new PMatrix such that it represents the geometric transform that maps the rectangle specified by the rect parameter to the parallelogram defined by the three points in the plgpts parameter. The upper-left corner of the rectangle is mapped to the first point in the plgpts array, the upper-right corner is mapped to the second point, and the lower-left corner is mapped to the third point. The lower-left point of the parallelogram is implied by the first three.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix.#ctor(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.PointF[])
member.summary: Constructs a new PMatrix initialized to the geometric transform defined by the specified rectangle and array of points.
member.param: A structure that represents the rectangle to be transformed.

An array of three structures that represents the points of a parallelogram to which the upper-left, upper-right, and lower-left corners of the rectangle is to be transformed. The lower-right corner of the parallelogram is implied by the first three corners.
member.remarks: This method initializes the new PMatrix such that it represents the geometric transform that maps the rectangle specified by the rect parameter to the parallelogram defined by the three points in the plgpts parameter. The upper-left corner of the rectangle is mapped to the first point in the plgpts array, the upper-right corner is mapped to the second point, and the lower-left corner is mapped to the third point. The lower-left point of the parallelogram is implied by the first three.

member.summary: Prepend to this object a clockwise rotation, around the origin and by the specified angle. object.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PMatrix.ShearBy(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies the specified shear vector to this object by prepending the shear transformation.
member.param: The horizontal shear factor.
The vertical shear factor.
member.remarks: The transformation applied in this method is a pure shear only if one of the parameters is 0. Applied to a rectangle at the origin, when the shearY factor is 0, the transformation moves the bottom edge horizontally by shearX times the height of the rectangle. When the shearX factor is 0, it moves the right edge vertically by shearY times the width of the rectangle. Caution is in order when both parameters are nonzero, because the results are hard to predict. For example, if both factors are 1, the transformation is singular (hence noninvertible), squeezing the entire plane to a single line.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PPickPath
member.summary: PPickPath represents an ordered list of nodes that have been picked.
member.remarks:
The topmost ancestor node is the last node in the list (and should be a camera), the bottommost child node is at the front of the list. It is this bottom node that is given first chance to handle events, and that any active event handlers usually manipulate.
Note that because of layers (which can be picked by multiple camera's) the ordered list of nodes in a pick path do not all share a parent child relationship with the nodes in the list next to them. This means that the normal LocalToGlobal methods don't work when trying to transform geometry up and down the pick path, instead you should use the pick path's CanvasToLocal methods to get the mouse event points into your local coord system.
Note that wraps most of the useful PPickPath methods, so often you can use a directly instead of accessing its pick path.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PStream
member.summary: PStream wraps a System.IO.Stream to handle optional elements.
member.remarks:
This is similar to the concept of "weak references", but applied to object serialization rather than garbage collection. Here, PStream provides a method, , which only serializes the specified object if there is a strong reference (if it has already been written) to that object elsewhere in the stream.
To discover strong references to objects, PStream uses a two-phase writing process. First, a "discovery" phase is used to find out what objects are about to be serialized. This works by effectively serializing the object graph to /dev/null, recording which objects are unconditionally written using the standard GetObjectData method. Then, in the second "write" phase, PStream actually serializes the data to the stream. During this phase, calls to will only write the specified object if the object was found to be serialized during the discovery stage. If the object was not recorded during the discovery stage, a null value is unconditionally written in place of the object.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructs a new PStream.
member.param: The stream to to write to.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PStream.WriteObjectTree(System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter,System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes the object tree to the underlying stream using the given formatter.
member.param: The formatter to use when serializing the object.
The object to serialize.
member.remarks: Applications should call this method to serialize a part of the scene graph. The nodes in the scene graph may then choose to conditionally serialize their references by calling WriteConditionalObject from their GetObjectData method. For example, all nodes implemented in the piccolo framework conditionally serialize their parents so that serializing a node won't pull in the entire object graph. See PNode.GetObjectData.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PStream.ReadObjectTree(System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter)
member.summary: Deserializes the object tree from the underlying stream using the given formatter.
member.param: The formatter to use when deserializing the object.
member.returns: The deserialized object.

member.summary: Conditionally adds the given object to the given System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, using the specified name.
member.param: The to add the object to.
The name to use when adding the object to the .
The object to add to the .
member.remarks: This method only serializes the specified object if there is a strong reference (if it has already been written) to that object elsewhere in the stream.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PStream.RecordUnconditionallyWritten(System.Object,System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector)
member.summary: Performs a discovery phase to find out which objects are about to be serialized.
member.param: The object to perform the discover phase on.
The surrogate selector to check when serializing the object graph.
member.remarks: This works by effectively serializing the object graph to /dev/null, recording which objects are unconditionally written using the standard GetObjectData method.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PStream.RecordWrittenSurrogateSelector
member.summary: RecordWrittenSurrogateSelector is a surrogate selector that will always return a , regardless of the type specified.
member.remarks: This class is used in the discovery phase. The binary formatter is given this surrogate selector so that each time an object is serialized, the method will be called. This makes it possible to avoid registerring every type in the namespace with a standard System.Runtime.Serialization.SurrogateSelector.

member.summary: Adds a surrogate to the framework surrogate selector.
member.param: The for which the surrogate is required.
The context-specific data.
The surrogate to call for this type.
member.remarks: Surrogates that are added in this way will be used by the piccolo framework for cloning operations. For example, if several custom nodes reference a type that is not serializable, you might want to add a surrogate here for that type. Alternatively, you could override in each custom node and specify how to serialize the type there.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PUtil.GreekThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a system wide value that specifies the smallest size at which nodes should render themselves completely.
member.value: The smallest size at which nodes should render themselves completely.
member.remarks: Once a node becomes very small, it is no longer necessary to render it completely since it is impossible to see the details anyway. When this happens, you might choose to simply render a filled rectangle or nothing at all. This property specifies when nodes should be "greeked". Note, however, there is nothing in the piccolo framework that enforces the "greeking" of nodes. Nodes can choose to ignore this property. For an example of "greeking," see PText.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.Util.PUtil.MaxFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a system wide value that specifies the maximum size at which text should be rendered.
member.value: The maximum size at which text should be rendered.
member.remarks: This value specifies the largest font size at which text should be rendered. Nodes that have text should pay attention to this value. Note, however, there is nothing in the piccolo framework that enforces nodes to stop rendering text at this size. For an example of a node that uses this property, see PText.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
Piccolo.NET is a general-purpose c#-based engine that supports 2D visualizations. A primary characteristic of Piccolo.NET is that it is designed to support zoomable information spaces, although any particular applications may or may not take advantage of this feature. Piccolo is implemented entirely in C#, and as such runs identically on any platform that supports the CLR.
Piccolo is not an application in itself, but rather it is an engine that is designed to support applications that require the ability to create, manipulate, and render object-oriented graphics. If you are familiar with the terminology of 3D graphics, Piccolo supports a scenegraph. This is a data structure that represents a hierarchy of graphical objects. Piccolo uses a tuned run-time system to render the scenegraph as quickly as possible to support interactive applications.
This is the root namespace for all Piccolo classes. It contains the core scenegraph classes itself, and in addition, contains the Activities, Event, Nodes and Util namespaces that are used to build Piccolo applications.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.CameraViewConstraint
member.summary: This enumeration is used by the PCamera class. It represents the types of constraints that can be applied to a camera's view matrix.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.CameraViewConstraint.None
member.summary: No constraint should be applied to the view.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.CameraViewConstraint.All
member.summary: Try to keep the entire bounds of all the camera's layers within the camera's view.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.CameraViewConstraint.Center
member.summary: Try to keep the center point of all the camera's layers within the camera's view.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCamera
member.summary: PCamera represents a viewport onto a list of layer nodes.
member.remarks:
Each camera maintains a view transform through which it views these layers. Translating and scaling this view transform is how zooming and panning are implemented.
Cameras are also the point through which all PInputEvents enter Piccolo. The canvas coordinate system, and the local coordinate system of the topmost camera should always be the same.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCamera.AnimateViewToCenterBounds(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Boolean,System.Int64)
member.summary: Animate the camera's view from its current matrix when the activity starts to a new matrix that centers the given bounds in the camera layers' coordinate system into the camera's view bounds.
member.param: The bounds to center the view on.
Indicates whether the camera should scale it's view when necessary to fully fit the given bounds within the camera's view bounds.
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity, if the duration is greater than 0; else null.
member.remarks: If the duration is 0 then the view will be transformed immediately, and null will be returned. Else a new PTransformActivity will get returned that is set to animate the cameras view matrix to the new bounds. If shouldScaleToFit is true, then the camera will also scale its view so that the given bounds fit fully within the camera's view bounds, else the camera will maintain its original scale.

member.name: M:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCamera.AnimateViewToPanToBounds(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Int64)
member.summary: Pan the camera's view from its current matrix when the activity starts to a new matrix so that the view bounds will contain (if possible, intersect if not possible) the new bounds in the camera layers' coordinate system.
member.param: The bounds to pan the view to.
The amount of time that the animation should take.
member.returns: The newly scheduled activity, if the duration is greater than 0; else null.
member.remarks: If the duration is 0 then the view will be transformed immediately, and null will be returned. Else a new PTransformActivity will get returned that is set to animate the cameras view matrix to the new bounds.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCanvas.ZoomEventHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom event handler associated with this canvas.
member.value: The zoom event handler for this canvas.
member.remarks: This event handler is set up to get events from the camera associated with this canvas by default.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCanvas.RegionManagement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not region management should be used when painting.
member.value: A value that indicates whether or not region management should be used when painting.
member.remarks: When region management is turned on, only the nodes that have been invalidated will be painted to the screen. Typically, this will provide the best performance. In some cases, however, the cost of invalidating lots of rectangles is greater than the cost of painting the entire window. For example, if you have a scene filled with lots of animating rectangles where the bounds of each rectangle are invalidated on every frame, you might get better performance by turning off region management.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCanvas.GridFitText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if text should be rendered with hinting.
member.remarks: When grid-fitting is turned on, the position of the pixels in each rendered glyph are adjusted to make the glyph easily legible at various screen sizes. This will result in higher quality text. However, grid-fitting will also change the size of the glyphs, which can make it difficult to display adjacent text. And, while zooming, the text may appear jumpy.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCanvas.Interacting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if this canvas is interacting.
member.value: True if the canvas is interacting; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this property is true, the canvas will normally render at a lower quality that is faster.

member.name: P:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PCanvas.Animating
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if this canvas is animating.
member.value: True if the canvas is animating; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Returns true if any activities that respond with true to the method isAnimating were run in the last PRoot.ProcessInputs() loop.

member.value: The default render quality for this canvas.
member.remarks: The default value is RenderQuality.HighQuality.

member.summary: Sets the render quality that should be used for rendering this canvas when it is animating.
member.value: The animating render quality for this canvas.
member.remarks: The default value is RenderQuality.LowQuality.

member.summary: Set the render quality that should be used for rendering this canvas when it is interacting.
member.value: The interacting render quality for this canvas.
member.remarks: The default value is RenderQuality.LowQuality.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PLayer
member.summary: PLayer is a node that can be viewed directly by multiple camera nodes.
member.remarks:
Generally child nodes are added to a layer to give the viewing cameras something to look at.
A single layer node may be viewed through multiple cameras with each camera using its own view matrix. This means that any node (since layers can have children) may be visible through multiple cameras at the same time.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PLayer.PROPERTY_CODE_CAMERAS

member.remarks: This field is used to indicate whether CamerasChanged events should be forwarded to a node's parent. PPropertyEventArgs. PropertyChangeParentMask.

member.name: F:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PLayer.PROPERTY_KEY_CAMERAS
member.summary: The key that identifies a change in the set of this layer's cameras.
member.remarks: In a property change event the new value will be a reference to the list of this nodes cameras, but old value will always be null.

member.name: E:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PLayer.CamerasChanged
member.summary: Occurs when there is a change in the set of this layer's cameras.
member.remarks: When a user attaches an event handler to the CamerasChanged Event as in CamerasChanged += new PPropertyEventHandler(aHandler), the add method adds the handler to the delegate for the event (keyed by PROPERTY_KEY_CAMERAS in the Events list). When a user removes an event handler from the CamerasChanged event as in CamerasChanged -= new PPropertyEventHandler(aHandler), the remove method removes the handler from the delegate for the event (keyed by PROPERTY_KEY_CAMERAS in the Events list).

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PaintInvalidatedDelegate
member.summary: A delegate that recieves low level paint invalidated events.
member.remarks: Used to recieve low level node events. This delegate together with the FullBoundsInvalidatedDelegate gives Piccolo users an efficient way to learn about low level changes in Piccolo's scene graph. Most users will not need to use this.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.FullBoundsInvalidatedDelegate
member.summary: A delegate that recieves low level full bounds invalidated events.
member.remarks: Used to recieve low level node events. This delegate together with the PaintInvalidatedDelegate gives Piccolo users an efficient way to learn about low level changes in Piccolo's scene graph. Most users will not need to use this.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PInputEventHandler
member.summary: A delegate that is used to register for mouse and keyboard events on a PNode.
member.Remarks: Note the events that you get depend on the node that you have registered with. For example you will only get mouse moved events when the mouse is over the node that you have registered with, not when the mouse is over some other node. For more control over events, a listener class can be registered rather than an event handler method.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.PPropertyEventHandler
member.summary: A delegate that is used to register for property change events on a PNode.
member.remarks: Note the events that you get depend on the node that you have registered with. For example you will only get a bounds PropertyEvent when the bounds of the node that you have registered with changes, not when some other node's bounds change.

member.name: T:UMD.HCIL.Piccolo.ProcessScheduledInputsDelegate
